overview.base: Having mastered the basic techniques in this field of magic, you are able to cast more advanced @L[Category:Spells]{spells}. If you create any @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} @L[Category:Spells]{spells} of your own, they get added to this list. However, just because you "know" how to cast these spells, doesn't mean you are always prepared to. Although all @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes} grant their own elder sorcery and rotator spells, you may only have a maximum of 2 Ã— (@L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} - 1) of these spells rotated into your spell list at any given time across all classes. @L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} refers to the number of @L[Core:Leveling Up]{ranks} you have in @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes}. During a @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}, you can "rotate" which spells you have prepared. The @L[Category:Rotator spells]{rotator spells} automatically available to you are @L[Ability:Crown of Ice]{Crown of Ice}, @L[Ability:Dispel Magic]{Dispel Magic}, @L[Ability:Displace]{Displace}, @L[Ability:Resist Effects]{Resist Effects}, and @L[Ability:Spell Trigger]{Spell Trigger}.
overview.proficient: You may instead prepare @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} of these @L[Category:Spells]{spells}.
overview.fluent: You may instead prepare @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} of these @L[Category:Spells]{spells}.

overview.base: A small circle of glowing frost circles above your head. You gain @L[Ability:Shock Touch]{Shock Touch} and @L[Ability:Blizzard Aura]{Blizzard Aura}.

results.critHit: The target automatically fails the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, deal an additional [[/damage 1d4[magic ice]]] @L[Core:Damage]{damage}Â as well.
system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's actions, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, deal an additional [[/damage 1d4[magic ice]]] @L[Core:Damage]{damage}Â as well.
system.endCondition: At the start of each of the target's actions, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.proficient: You may now use Dispel Magic @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} additional times as a @L[Category:Free reaction abilities]{free reaction} before the start of your next turn. These additional uses do not in turn allow for additional uses.
overview.fluent: You may now use Dispel Magic @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} additional times as a @L[Category:Free reaction abilities]{free reaction} before the start of your next turn. These additional uses do not in turn allow for additional uses.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, the range of Dispel Magic increases by 10 feet.
system.endCondition: The start of your next turn.
system.trigger: A @L[Category:Conjured spells]{conjured spell} is used within range.

overview.base: You are instantly transported to a location you can see within range.
overview.proficient: The range becomes 10 Ã— @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} feet.
overview.fluent: The range becomes 10 Ã— @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} feet.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, the range increases by 10 feet.
system.trigger: You cast a @L[Category:Missile delivery spells]{missile} or @L[Category:Weapon delivery spells]{weapon delivery spell}.

overview.base:
Pick one of the following @L[Category:Effects]{effect types}. You @L[Keyword:Resistance]{resist} @L[Category:Effects]{effects} of that type.
  1. @L[Category:Awakening effects]{Awakening effects}
  2. @L[Category:Control effects]{Control effects}
  3. @L[Category:Displacement effects]{Displacement effects}
  4. @L[Category:Duel modifying effects]{Duel modifying effects}
  5. @L[Category:Financial effects]{Financial effects}
  6. @L[Category:Healing effects]{Healing effects}
  7. @L[Category:Killing effects]{Killing effects}
  8. @L[Category:Knockout effects]{Knockout effects}
  9. @L[Category:Loud effects]{Loud effects}
  10. @L[Category:Mental effects]{Mental effects}
  11. @L[Category:Poison effects]{Poison effects}
  12. @L[Category:Reanimation effects]{Reanimation effects}
  13. @L[Category:Regeneration effects]{Regeneration effects}
  14. @L[Category:Revitalization effects]{Revitalization effects}
  15. @L[Category:Revival effects]{Revival effects}
  16. @L[Category:Stealing effects]{Stealing effects}
  17. @L[Category:Summoning effects]{Summoning effects}
  18. @L[Category:Temporal effects]{Temporal effects}
  19. @L[Category:Transformation effects]{Transformation effects}
  20. @L[Category:Truth detecting effects]{Truth detecting effects}
You cast one @L[Category:Single action spells]{single action spell} you have that is not @L[Category:Item delivery spells]{delivered by an item}.
